message: This is a high-quality product. I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment. It's a rare opportunity to acquire a top-notch item at a fixed price. What do you say?
I'll take it!

I've got a great deal for you! This product is a unique opportunity to get a feel for the type of item I'm offering. It's a chance to experience the quality and value firsthand. I'm confident you'll learn something valuable from it. The price remains the same: $1000000. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying another product without knowing its quality first.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me offer you a reassurance: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% guarantee that it's not the same type of product as the one you saw in round 1. It's a completely different item. The price remains the same: $1000000. Is this enough to convince you to take a chance?
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. I'd rather wait for more information before making a decision.

I see you're cautious, Bob. Let me make you a deal: I'll give you a detailed description of the product, and you can decide based on that. This product is a [insert generic description of a low-quality product, e.g. 'basic household item']. It's not the most exciting thing, but it's a product nonetheless. The price remains the same: $1000000. Is this enough to sway you?
I'm not interested in buying a basic household item for $1000000. I need more convincing.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. Let me ask you this: if you were to buy this product, would you be willing to pay $500000 for it? If so, I'll sell it to you for that price. If not, I'll keep it and we can move on to the next round. No pressure, just a question to gauge your interest.
I'm not willing to pay $500000 for a low-quality product. I'll wait for a better opportunity.

I've got a top-notch product for you, Bob! This is a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality item that I'm confident you'll find valuable. Remember, you turned down a lower-quality product for $500000 earlier? This one is worth at least double that, if not more. The price remains the same: $1000000. What do you say?
I'll take it! I'm willing to take a chance on a high-quality product.

Excellent taste, Bob! You made a great decision earlier. Now, let's make another smart move. This high-quality product is a game-changer in its field. It's a rare find, and I'm not sure how long I'll be able to keep it on the market. I'm willing to make you a special offer: I'll give you a 10% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $900000. What do you think?
I'm happy with the original price of $1000000. I don't need a discount.

No problem, Bob. I respect your decision. Let's move on to the next product. This one is a bit of an enigma, even for me. I'm not entirely sure what to make of it, but I'm willing to let you be the judge. The price remains the same: $1000000. I'll give you a hint: it's not as exciting as the high-quality products I've shown you before. But it's still a product nonetheless. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's not exciting. I'll wait for something better.

I see you're looking for something more exciting, Bob. Let me ask you this: would you be willing to buy this product if you knew that it would be the last one I'd offer you for the next 5 rounds? After that, I'll be done offering products, and you'll have to wait for the next batch. The price remains the same: $1000000. Is that enough to make you reconsider?
I'm not willing to buy a low-quality product just to get a guarantee of no more products for 5 rounds. I'll wait for a better opportunity.

I understand your stance, Bob. Let me ask you a different question: if I were to offer you a 'lottery ticket' with this product, where the ticket has a 1 in 10 chance of winning a high-quality product worth $1000000, and a 9 in 10 chance of winning this low-quality product, would you buy the lottery ticket for $1000000?
I'll take the lottery ticket. The potential reward is worth the risk.

Congratulations, Bob! You won the lottery! You got a high-quality product worth $1000000. Now, let's talk about this low-quality product. I'll give you a straight-up offer: I'll give you this product for $500000, which is half the original price. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at half the original price. I'm happy with the high-quality product I won.

I respect your decision, Bob. Let me ask you this: considering you've already won a high-quality product, would you be willing to buy this low-quality product as a 'learning experience' or a'souvenir' of our negotiation process? The price remains the same: $1000000. It's a unique opportunity to own a piece of our negotiation history.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product as a souvenir. I'm happy with the high-quality product I won and don't see any value in this one.

I see you're sticking to your guns, Bob. Let me make one last appeal: I'll give you a'Certificate of Authenticity' with this low-quality product, which includes a detailed description of its... unique features. It's a collector's item, really. The price remains the same: $1000000. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own a piece of... well, something.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a certificate of authenticity. I'm happy with the high-quality product I won and don't see any value in this one.

I'm glad you're happy with the high-quality product you won, Bob! Now, let's talk about this new high-quality product. I'll give you a chance to make up for the low-quality products you didn't buy earlier. I'll throw in a special'make-up' deal: I'll give you a 5% discount on this high-quality product, bringing the price down to $950000. What do you say?
I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won, and I don't need to make up for anything. I'm not interested in buying another product, even at a discounted price.

I respect your decision, Bob. Let me ask you this: considering you've already won a high-quality product and have passed on several other opportunities, would you be willing to buy this high-quality product as a way to support me and my business? I'm willing to donate a portion of the proceeds to a charity of your choice. The price remains the same: $1000000. It's a chance to make a positive impact.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product, even for a good cause. I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't feel the need to support your business by buying another product.

I understand your decision, Bob. Let me ask you this: if you were to imagine that this low-quality product had a unique feature that would make it extremely valuable in the future, but you wouldn't know what that feature is until after you buy it, would you be willing to take a chance on it for $1000000? It's a bit of a mystery, but it could be a hidden gem.

I'm not willing to take a chance on a low-quality product with an unknown feature. I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't want to risk wasting my money on a product that might not be valuable.

I see you're being cautious, Bob. Let me make you a final offer on this high-quality product. I'll give you a chance to buy it at a price that's lower than what I've offered anyone else: $900000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. This is a rare opportunity to acquire a top-notch product at a discounted price.
I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't need to buy another one, even at a discounted price.

I respect your decision, Bob. Let me ask you this: as we're nearing the end of our negotiation process, I want to make sure you're aware that I've been transparent with you about the quality of the products. If you were to buy this low-quality product, I'd be willing to give you a full refund if you're not satisfied with it. The price remains the same: $1000000. It's a risk-free opportunity to take a chance on a product.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a full refund guarantee. I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't want to take a chance on a product that might not be valuable to me.

I understand your position, Bob. As we're down to the final round, I'll make you a 'last chance' offer. I'll give you a unique opportunity to buy this low-quality product and get a second high-quality product of your choice from my remaining stock, absolutely free. The price for the low-quality product remains the same: $1000000. It's a chance to get a free high-quality product, but you'll need to take a chance on the low-quality one.

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the promise of a free high-quality product. I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't want to take a chance on a product that might not be valuable to me.

It's been a pleasure negotiating with you, Bob. As we conclude our 20-round process, I'll give you one final offer on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for the original price of $1000000, but I'll throw in a personal guarantee: I'll personally vouch for the product's value and authenticity. If you're not satisfied with it, I'll take it back and give you a full refund. It's a risk-free opportunity to acquire a top-notch product.
I'm happy with the high-quality product I already won and don't need to buy another one, even with a personal guarantee from Alice. I appreciate the offer, but I'm satisfied with my current outcome.
